text: Seagrass meadows remove pathogens from ocean water
Researchers studied bacteria that are harmful to humans and coral

Surveys of 8000 corals showed those near seagrass
were half as likely to be diseased

and a bacterium harmful to people was reduced
threefold

Preserving seagrass ecosystems can improve
sanitation for humans
Saving corals and seagrass is more cost effective than adding infrastructure

Such ecosystem services have value for sanitation,
aquaculture, and tourism -- to name a few

If we can protect seagrass, it will protect
us back
